definition[0]: if something belongs to someone, they own it
example[1]: Who does this scarf belong to?
definition[1]: to be a member of a group or organization
example[2]: He belongs to the golf club.
definition[2]: to be related to something or form part of it
example[3]: cars that belong to a different era
definition[3]: to be related to or produced by a particular person
example[4]: She recognized the voice as belonging to the man who had attacked her.
definition[4]: if a competition or period of time belongs to someone, they are the most important or successful person in it
example[5]: All the acts were good, but the evening belonged to a dance group from Moscow.
